Event: Azerbaijan seized back significant amounts of territory it had lost to Armenian forces in the 1990s.
Armenia accused Azerbaijan of conducting an “ongoing military build-up along the line of contact in Nagorno-Karabakh and the Armenia-Azerbaijan border”.
Azerbaijan’s foreign ministry rejected the Armenian assertion and called on Yerevan to end what Baku called “military and political provocations.”
Russia said on Thursday it was continuing to fulfil its role as a security guarantor in the South Caucasus.
Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov criticised Armenia’s decision to host a joint exercise involving 85 US soldiers next week as unhelpful.
Azerbaijan took control of Nagorno-Karabakh after three decades in a lightning military operation and vowed to prosecute the "criminal" separatist leadership.
Russian truck sets off with food aid for Armenians in Khankendi - Reuters witness.
Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan emphasizes the importance of peace for Armenia's continued independence following the surrender of the Nagorno-Karabakh region to Azerbaijan.

Under Pashinyan's presidency, Azerbaijan regained control of territories in the Nagorno-Karabakh region that had been under the control of ethnic Armenian separatists for three decades, culminating in the region's complete capture this week.
Azerbaijani armed forces attacked Kochoghot village in the Martakert district of Karabakh after attacks on its own citizens.
Petya Grigoryan and thousands of other Armenians fled Karabakh to Armenia after a 24-hour Azerbaijani military operation.
Thousands of Armenians gathered at the airport in Nagorno-Karabakh after a ceasefire agreement was reached with Azerbaijan.
Several hundred protesters gathered in the Armenian capital to demand that the government to do more to support ethnic Armenians in Nagorno-Karabakh.
Ethnic Armenian separatist authorities reported a major escalation of hostilities in Azerbaijan's Nagorno-Karabakh region, as Azerbaijan launched an offensive.
